channel.title: About me on Simon Rolph
channel.description: Recent content in About me on Simon Rolph

item.title: PhD Overview
item.description: I’m based at the University of Sheffield and I’m funded by the Leverhulme Centre for Advanced Biological Modelling (CABM). CABM aims to harness cutting edge mathematical and computing skills to address major problems in biology. Additionally, I’m affiliated with the University of Oxford through my supervisor Rob Salguero-Gómez (so I get free access the the botanical gardens!). Supervisors Part of a team. I am part of Dr Dylan Child’s lab group.

item.title: Simon Rolph - CV
item.description: Education 2016 - Present, University of Sheffield, PhD Student PhD student at the University of Sheffield, Department of Animal and Plant science. Primary supervisor: Dr Dylan Childs, with supporting supervisors; Dr Rob Salguero-Gómez, Dr Jonathan Potts and Proffessor Rob Freckleton. President of the Animal and Plant Sciences Department PostGrad Soceity (June 2017-current) 2013-2016, University of Exeter BSc (Hons) in Conservation Biology and Ecology at University of Exeter (Penryn Campus) 1st Class.
